title: Perceived ROI level from digital marketing channels worldwide 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondant on the Y-axis for 9 different Responses for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A that are presented on the X-axis.

In Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant 43.0 among the 4 groups and in Social media (organic), Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant 8.0.
Among all the Responses, Don't use or N/A had the highest Share of respondant in Response Website personalization and lowest Share of respondant in Response Social media (organic).
Response Website personalization and Social media (organic) had the biggest gap of 32.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondant found for Don't use or N/A.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondant on the Y-axis for 9 different Responses for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A that are presented on the X-axis.

Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation had the maximum Share of respondant among all 4 groups, and it was for Medium ROI. The minimum Share of respondant was observed in Response Social media (organic) for Don't use or N/A.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondant on the Y-axis for 9 different Responses for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A that are presented on the X-axis.

In Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant 43.0 among the 4 groups and in Social media (organic), Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant 8.0.
Among all the Responses, Don't use or N/A had the highest Share of respondant in Response Website personalization and lowest Share of respondant in Response Social media (organic).
Response Website personalization and Social media (organic) had the biggest gap of 32.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondant found for Don't use or N/A.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different Responses on X-axis for 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondant.

Out of all 4 groups, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant in Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation and Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant in Response Social media (organic).
Among all the Responses, Don't use or N/A had the highest Share of respondant in Response Website personalization and lowest Share of respondant in Response Social media (organic).
There is a gap of 32.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondant found for Don't use or N/A in Response Website personalization and Social media (organic).
Among all 4 groups, Highest ROI had the gap of 22.0 between the maximum and minimum Share of respondant observed in Response SEO and Display advertising including programmatic respectively.

In Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation, Medium ROI had the highest Share of respondant 43.0 among the 4 groups and in Social media (organic), Don't use or N/A had the lowest Share of respondant 8.0. The second highest Share of respondant 33.0 was observed for Medium ROI in Response E-mail marketing and marketing automation.

Averaging all 4 groups Lowest ROI, Medium ROI, Highest ROI, and Don't use or N/A, the Response Display advertising including programmatic is the maximum Share of respondant and SEO is the minimum Share of respondant.
